result.execSummary:
The defendant JOSHUA JAMES PETERMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
FINE/COSTS PAID IN FULL

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, please call 920-236-4906 to arrange an appointment with Winnebago County Sheriff located at the Winnebago County Courthouse: Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 02:11 PM  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSHUA JAMES PETERMAN in court.  Attorney Christine Bruen in court for JOSHUA JAMES PETERMAN. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law - victim via phone.  Case resolved - plea entered.

You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.  No violent contact with V1.
Defendant JOSHUA JAMES PETERMAN in court with attorney Jeffrey P Kippa.  Tucker T. Tellefson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
